intro: Lampranthus tanquanus, commonly known as the Crimson Carpet, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces vibrant red or orange flowers during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure to flourish. Due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
